item.title: Emission Trading System Outlook
item.description: â€‹ What is the most effective policy measures for preventing climate change? This singular question has been in the back of leaders' minds ever since the first national UNFCC in 1992. By December 1997, in Kyoto, Japan, the market mechanism of cap-and-trade systems was conceived as the new pathway for reducing greenhouse gas emissions proposed by the United States. Since then, more national and subnational jurisdictions and private sector entities are adopting carbon pricing.
